titles: Iames be the grace of God, King of Great Britane, France, and Ireland, defender of the faith &c. to the prouest and ballies of our bourgh of [blank] and to our louits [blank] messingers, our schireffes in that part coniunctlie and seueralie specialie constitute greiting : forsameikle as the three estates of our kingdome of Scotland ... ane taxation to bee payed ...
author: Scotland. Sovereign (1567-1625 : James VI)
James I, King of England, 1566-1625.
notes: "Given vnder our signet, at Perth the nynt day of Julie, and of our regne the ferd and threttie nyne zeares 1606."
Imperfect: torn, with some loss of print.
Reproduction of original in the Town House (Aberdeen, Scotland). Charter Room.
